intro: Pectis multiseta, commonly known as the many-bristled pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in dense, flattened clusters. Pectis multiseta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its bristly appearance and unique floral structure make it a distinctive species within its native range.
